Description: Both the Hybrid Azure Local Architecture and the Cloud-Native Application Security model share threats related to unauthorized access and data tampering.
Mitigations for session hijacking and insufficient logging are shared across the Azure Virtual Desktop and traditional VDI models.
Attack patterns related to denial of service are common across both the Hybrid Azure Local Architecture and on-premises data centers.
Both the Hybrid Azure Local Architecture and the Financial Services Compliance model have overlapping compliance requirements related to data protection.
The technology stacks of the Hybrid Azure Local Architecture and the Kubernetes Security Framework share common components, leading to similar vulnerabilities.

Source: Repeated incidents of unauthorized access attempts across multiple threat models indicate a systemic issue with access controls.
Frequent data tampering incidents highlight vulnerabilities in data handling processes.
Common vulnerabilities related to session hijacking across remote access technologies.
